intro: Alexa canaracunensis, commonly known as the Canary Islands bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms during the spring and summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
